intro: Arctostaphylos refugioensis, commonly known as the Refugio manzanita, is a shrub native to the coastal regions of California. It is characterized by its evergreen foliage and clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in the spring. The plant produces edible berries that are typically consumed by various wildlife species. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to coastal climates with mild winters and warm, dry summers. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
